title: Research
text:
FiO+LS 2023, Washington, USA


Femtosecond Laser based Post-Processing Free True Random Number Generator
Amritash Sharma †, Prasanna Paithankar †, Shailendra K Varshney
Abstract: We experimentally demonstrate a high-entropy source based on the intensity fluctuation in a femtosecond laser. The setup successfully passes statistical tests without any post-processing. The generator can be potentially used for quantum communication and cryptography.  Poster  |   Abstract  |   Supplementary


Indian Journal of Pure & Applied Physics (IJPAP)



Microring Resonators and its Applications
Sauradeep Kar, Sridhar Singhal, Prasanna Paithankar & Shailendra K Varshney
Abstract: Microring resonators (MRRs) are the most sought on-chip optical components after the optical waveguides due to versatile usages and functionalities whether in linear or nonlinear and quantum properties. A simple MRR geometry consists of one or two straight waveguides and circular or bent waveguides. Due to huge potential and versatility, we provide a comprehensive review on microring resonators that encompasses from material selection to applications and various configurations.  Paper


COPaQ 2022, Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee



Tunable Graphene-Integrated Cascaded Silicon Microring Resonators
Prasanna Paithankar, Sridhar Singhal, Sauradeep Kar & Shailendra K Varshney
Abstract: We theoretically and numerically demonstrate a tunable graphene-integrated cascaded tapered racetrack microring resonator (TRMRR) system. We have derived transmission field amplitudes of such cascaded system without graphene. The deposition of graphene on the PNF region produces an optoelectronically tunable transmission with an appreciable extinction by harnessing the unique advantages of graphene and cascaded resonator system. The proposed device can be potentially used for sensing and modulator applications.  Poster  |   Abstract


Prasanna Paithankar | Deptarment of Computer Science & Engineering | Indian Insitute of Technology KharagpurMade using Quarto

title: Prasanna Paithankar
text:
I am currently a junior undergraduate at Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, pursuing a BTech+MTech in Computer Science and Technology.
My general research interests lie in field of photonic based computation, pseudorandomness and statistical learning theory. I am an undergraduate researcher at Fiber Optics and Nano and Quantum Photonics Group (FONQP), Advanced Photonics Laboratory (APL), IIT Kharagpur, under the guidance of Professor Shailendra Varshney.
I also make financial softwares and scripts for aiding Chartered Accountants and Tax professionals and one would find me either swimming at TSG pool or in APL. 


News
[10/10/23] FiO + LS 2023 Conference: Manuscript titled “Femtosecond Laser based Post-Processing Free True Random Number Generator” has been present at FiO+LS 2023 conference at Tacoma, Washington.
[30/06/23] IJPAP Revew Article: Review article titled “Microring Resonators and its Applications” has been published in Indian Journal of Pure and Applied Physics (IJPAP) Vol.61(07).
